ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained a deeper understanding of Chinese culture and formal language.
I learned about the fundamentals of Chinese culture, especially calligraphy, art, and philosophy.
I learned more advanced chinese language that I have now been using in conversations with relatives.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I enjoyed that I was able to get to know my classmates on a more personal level, which made the entire class feel more fun and collaborative. I also enjoyed the passages we read in the class and thought they were very applicable to the class.

I really enjoyed the environment that Prof Xu and Prof Wang cultivated in class. Not only did we learn about Chinese philosophy, traditions, and mandarin, we also had a chance to study topics that interested us as well. The projects were very enlightening, both working on our own and listening to other groups who have insights we lacked. The discussions we had in class were interesting and often funny.
I think this course was very well taught, I don't have that many comments on how it could be improved other than maybe a bit more balanced class discussions.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely! The workload is more than manageable and our professors offered clear feedbacks regarding our speaking, writing, and reading levels. I learned how to express myself more fluently because of our (often funny and sometimes out of context) discussions.
Yes! I learned a lot about Chinese culture and modern Chinese society.
Yes, this course is very good at teaching you more advanced language skills that could be used in an academic setting, or for understanding a wider variety of everyday Chinese speech.
